1.title: Cathy. book 1
1.author: by Don Lawrence.
notes: Each opening is a series of pictures that tell a story without words, in a pinup style.

2.heading: Cathy.
2.title: The Blank in the Comics strip collection includes a file of one or more daily comic strips related to this keyword or topic. Call no.: PN6726 f.B55
2.author: [No author]

3.heading: Cathy.
3.title: "John and Cathy"
3.author: Jim Burns
3.appears_in: cover of Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 11 (Feb. 1981).

4.title: Cathy
4.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
4.series: Dec. 18, 1984) "Throw Things Out the Window and Charge Them to My Accout!"*
notes: Summary: Cathy can't find a parking spot at the mall.

5.title: Cathy
5.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Cathy's mother says some denial is normal, but they should be planning a baby shower because Andrea's due in three weeks.

6.title: Cathy
6.author: Guisewite.
6.series: May 29, 1986) "What's the Matter, Don't You Like Babies?"*
notes: Summary: Andrea is telling Cathy what it's like to be pregnant, and somebody asks about her career.

7.title: Cathy
7.author: Guisewite.
7.series: May 30, 1986) "Another Perfect Delivery Made Possible Through Lamaze"*
notes: Summary: The Lamaze teacher pushes Cathy out the door, while Andrea talks about fulfillment.

8.title: Cathy
8.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Andrea's unborn baby has only been exposed to PBS, except for one Saturday morning walk by a TV set playing cartoons. We see the baby's thought balloon.

9.title: Cathy
9.author: Guisewite.
9.series: June 3, 1986) "We Have No Maternity Leave Here"*
notes: Summary: Andrea is talking to the personnel officer, who says she has only 3 sick days she can use.

10.title: Cathy
10.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Andrea discovers that her company offers only negative options.

11.title: Cathy
11.author: Guisewite.
11.series: June 5, 1986) "How I Love the Giggling and Gabbing of a Baby Shower!"*
notes: Summary: Andrea is lecturing on the status of maternity leave in the 117 nations of the world, as Cathy's mother arrives.

12.title: Cathy
12.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: At the baby shower, Cathy offers coffee and everybody wants to know how it was decaffeinated, stored and brewed. Then she offers pie and they eat first and ask questions later.

13.title: Cathy
13.author: Guisewite.
13.series: June 7, 1986) "I Finally Got a Whole Bag of Microwave Popcorn to Pop"*
notes: Summary: Cathy's been working on the popcorn for a year; and Andrea mentions that in that same year she met her husband (Luke), got married and pregnant.

14.title: Cathy
14.author: Guisewite.
14.series: June 9, 1986) "How Refreshing to See a Mother with a Firm Grip on Her Own Identity"*
notes: Summary: Andrea says she's not going to let the baby take over her life, but to Cathy it looks like the baby already has.

15.title: Cathy
15.author: Guisewite.
15.series: June 10, 1986) "Shouldn't You Buy Some Diapers or Something?"*
notes: Summary: Andrea's baby is due in a week, and she's busy playing concertos to it and teaching it Italian.

16.title: Cathy
16.author: Guisewite.
16.series: June 11, 1986) "Maybe It's Trying to Run Away"*
notes: Summary: Andrea's unborn baby kicks in music class, and kicks a lot when they say "Juilliard Scholarship".

17.title: Cathy
17.author: Guisewite.
17.series: June 18, 1986) "Do You Want a Boy or a Girl?"*
notes: Summary: Charlene and Cathy ask Andrea about her pregnancy.

18.title: Cathy
18.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Andrea and her husband tell the unborn baby why they can't wait for it to be born.

19.title: Cathy
19.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Andrea tries to get into the maternity ward.

20.title: Cathy
20.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
20.series: June 24, 1986) "Funny, Isn't It, That It's Us, the Woodstock Generation, Who Are Leading the Way in Drug-Free Childbirth?"*

21.title: Cathy
21.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
21.series: June 26, 1986) "Daddy, We're Getting Glare from Your Bald Spot"*
notes: Summary: After 17 hours of labor, the baby has arrived but the cameraman wants to stop and take it from the top.

22.title: Cathy
22.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: The newborn's first look is one of amazement.

23.title: Cathy
23.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: The baby screams when they show it a picture of Antonie van Leeuwenhoek.

24.title: Cathy
24.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Luke and Andrea just want a little quiet time in the hospital, but the nurses see it differently.

25.title: Cathy
25.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: Summary: The new parents have bought unisex everything for their baby, but are upset at Cathy's inability to tell if it's a boy or girl.

26.title: Cathy
26.author: Guisewite.
26.series: July 3, 1986) "Is it a Boy or a Girl?"*
notes: Summary: Andrea tries to keep the baby away from gender stereotyping, but it doesn't work for long.

27.title: Cathy
27.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: Summary: They've named the new baby with all kinds of superlative meanings in mind, and Cathy only thinks of a brand of television sets.

28.title: Cathy
28.author: Guisewite.
28.series: July 10, 1986) "Most Parents Have a 9-Second Attention Span"*
notes: Summary: Andrea tries to show Zenith flash cards of Simone de Beauvoir and the Mona Lisa, but gets distracted into baby talk.

29.title: Cathy
29.author: Guisewite.
29.series: July 11, 1986) "Buy Disposable and Send a Contribution to Greenpeace!"*
notes: Summary: Luke and Andrea are trying to be environmentally aware.

30.title: Cathy
30.author: Guisewite.
30.series: Sept. 2, 1986) "How Do You Keep Your House So Neat with a New Baby Here, Andrea?"*
notes: Summary: Andrea and Luke have stuffed everything into a cupboard.

31.title: Cathy
31.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
31.series: Sept. 3, 1986) "She Was Requesting the Ancient International Post-Feeding Ritual"
notes: Summary: Zenith is crying, and her parents think she may have been insulted by hearing Il Trovatore in English, but Cathy's mom burps her and everything's okay.

32.title: Cathy
32.author: by Cathy Guiswite.
notes: Summary: Andrea is teaching words to Zenith, and can't wait to be a career role model, and can't imagine going back to work and leaving her baby.

33.title: Cathy
33.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
33.series: Sept. 10, 1986) "Please let Us Pay You Something"*
notes: Summary: Andrea and Luke want Cathy to babysit.

34.title: Cathy
34.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
34.series: Sept. 12, 1986) "We Need an Evening to Just Relax"*
notes: Summary: Andrea and Luke are letting Cathy babysit, but the paramedics, in-laws and private SWAT team are on call.

35.title: Cathy
35.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
35.series: Sept. 15, 1986) "We Can't Leave Now, Luke. She's Too Upset"*
notes: Summary: Andrea can't leave her baby.

36.title: Cathy
36.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Andrea can't even leave the room to change her clothes.

37.title: Cathy
37.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Andrea has enjoyed her time at home with Zenith, but now it's time to go back to work.

38.title: Cathy
38.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Andrea wants to teach art history to Zenith at two months.

39.title: Cathy
39.author: Guisewite.
39.series: Sept. 19, 1986) "We Gave Away Your Job Last Month"*
notes: Summary: Andrea is in the personnel office with her baby, Zenith, and wants to come back to work.

40.title: Cathy
40.author: Guisewite.
40.series: Sept. 20, 1986) "Zenith! The Next Generation of Women!"*
notes: Summary: There's still "no materinity leave, no paternity leave, no flex-time and no day care" in Andrea's company.

41.title: Cathy
41.author: Guisewite.
41.series: Sept. 22, 1986) "This Company Believes in Old-Fashioned Values"*
notes: Summary: The personnel officer explains why they gave someone else Andrea's job.

42.title: Cathy
42.author: Guisewite.
42.series: Sept. 23, 1986) "If She Quits On Her Own, We Can Skip the Whole Severance Pay Fiasco"*
notes: Summary: Andrea's company would rather not fire a new mother.

43.title: Cathy
43.author: Guisewite.
43.series: Sept. 24, 1986) "Only Rich People Can Have Jobs"*
notes: Summary: Andrea is in the personnel office explaining that day care costs almost as much as she can earn.

44.title: Cathy
44.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Cathy tries to understand why new mothers aren't demonstrating for the Family and Medical Leave Act.

45.title: Cathy
45.author: Guisewite.
45.series: Apr. 13, 1987) "The Dental Floss of the Banking Industry"*
notes: Summary: Cathy contemplates an IRA over the telephone.

46.title: Cathy
46.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Cathy wonders where her makeup goes, and concludes that it goes into the air.

47.title: Cathy
47.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Irving has dated lots of women, but has never returned any clothes to the store.

48.title: Cathy
48.author: Guisewite.
48.series: Nov. 30, 1987) "I Want to See if that Hair of Hers Runs in the Gene Pool"*
notes: Summary: Irving's parents accept an invitation to brunch.

49.title: Cathy
49.author: Guisewite.
49.series: Sept. 26, 1988) "I'm Going to Get a Dog"*
notes: Summary: Cathy's friends rush home to husbands and children, and Cathy feels she's ready for commitment.

50.title: Cathy
50.author: Guisewite.
50.series: Sept. 27, 1988) "Why Can't You Just Do Something Easy Like Have a Baby?"*
notes: Summary: Cathy's mom warns her about the difficulties of dog ownership.

51.title: Cathy
51.author: Guisewite.
51.series: Oct. 3, 1988) "I Sense That We have Something in Common"*
notes: Summary: Electra tries to radiate calm and coolness from the Humane Society cage, then knocks Cathy over and licks her face.

52.title: Cathy
52.author: Guisewite.
52.series: Oct. 8, 1988) "It's So Much More Efficient to Just Cave In after the First Five Minutes"*
notes: Summary: Cathy's not going to let Electra slowly take over her whole life.

53.title: Cathy
53.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Andrea is actively campaigning to influence women's issues, and Zenith's play group is joining her, making it more than a grass roots campaign.

54.title: Cathy
54.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Electra understands why Cathy puts newspaper on the floor.

55.title: Cathy
55.author: Guisewite.
55.series: Oct. 12, 1989) "A Crisis Involving One of Your Golf Buddies?"*
notes: Summary: Cathy figures out why Mr. Pinkley's new crisis is more important than the crisis she's already working on.

56.title: Cathy
56.author: Guisewite.
56.series: Jan. 22, 1990) "Dancing with an Empty Container of Dental Floss"*
notes: Key words: Bathrooms, snuggling.

57.title: Cathy
57.author: Guisewite.
57.series: Feb. 19, 1991) "What a Woman Says/What a Man Hears"*
notes: Summary: Cathy asks Irving if golf is more important to him that a little romance, and he hears it as a suggestion to go play golf.

58.title: Cathy
58.author: by Cathy Guisewite
58.series: May 14, 1991) "Why Is It The Only Time Men Really Change It's Into Something Totally Aggravating?"*
58.appears_in: reproduced on p. 165 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Irving announces he's become a golfer.

59.title: Cathy
59.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Irving has finally quit working late and on weekends, and it's not to spend time with Cathy.

60.title: Cathy
60.author: Guisewite.
60.series: May 17, 1991) "At Least If He Were With Another Woman I'd Understand Why He Was Enjoying Himself!"*
notes: Summary: Cathy complains about Irving and his golf.

61.title: Cathy
61.author: Guisewite.
61.series: June 15, 1991) "742 Golf Courses Within a 60-Mile Radius"*
notes: Summary: Cathy has found a vacation area in California that Irving likes.

62.title: Cathy
62.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
62.series: July 11, 1991) "Somewhere Between Us is the Complete Experience"*
notes: Summary: Irving and Cathy have just played a round of golf, and have completely different recollections of it.

63.title: Cathy
63.author: by Cathy Guiswite.
63.series: July 27, 1991) "Can I Help It If Dogs are Better at Human Nature than Humans Are?"*
notes: Summary: Cathy notices how much harder she tries to please an aloof Electra, but when she tries it on Irving he heads straight to the driving range.

64.title: Cathy
64.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Irving always denies it when Cathy says he always does anything.

65.title: Cathy
65.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
65.series: Aug. 22, 1991) "What's That Cosmpolitan Magazine Doing in Your Briefcase?"*
notes: Summary: Cathy says she's through trying to entice Irving with hocus-pocus and costume.

66.title: Cathy
66.author: by Cathy Guisewite
66.series: Aug. 23, 1991) "I Have Met His Mistress, and She Wears a Little Sock on Her Head"*
66.appears_in: reproduced on p. 165 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Irving is late because he was at the driving range, and shows her the most forgiving wood in his bag.

67.title: Cathy
67.author: Guisewite.
67.series: Dec. 7, 1991) "I Haven't Left My Home and I Still Can't Find a Place to Park"*
notes: Summary: Can't find a place in the clutter of her apartment to sit and order from her holiday catalogs.

68.title: Cathy
68.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Cathy describes Spring, and being in love, to Irving.

69.title: Cathy
69.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Cathy discovers she's good at golf.

70.title: Cathy
70.author: Cathy Guisewite.
70.series: May 12, 1992) "I'm Playing Golf to Help us Stay a Couple, but Not to Become a Golf Couple"*
notes: Summary: Irving thinks women always turn everything into a whole different sport.

71.title: Cathy
71.author: Cathy Guisewite.
71.series: May 13, 1992) "The Fine Line Between Kissing and Spitting on her Owner's Face"*
notes: Summary: Electra feels sorry for Cathy, stuck in a building all day, but then finds out Cathy's been playing golf.

72.title: Cathy
72.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
72.series: Aug. 18, 1992) "Don't Look at Me. I Peaked in Kindergarten"*
notes: Summary: Charlene is planning to get new hairdo, body, clothes, and expertise before her wedding.

73.title: Cathy
73.author: Guisewite.
73.series: Mar. 31, 1993) "This is the Dawning of the Age of Aackquarius"*
notes: Summary: Cathy is at a clothing store trying on bell-bottoms, a polyester peace symbol tunic, platform clogs, hippie dresses, and love beads, and reacts negatively.

74.title: Cathy
74.author: Guisewite.
74.series: Aug. 20, 1993) "We'll Order Pizzas Every Night and Rent Lassie Videos!"*
notes: Summary: Cathy's father promises to brush Electra every day while Cathy's gone.

75.title: Cathy
75.author: Guisewite.
75.series: Aug. 25, 1993) "Mother and I Are Trying to Have Our Brunch Annulled"*
notes: Summary: It was a lapse of judgement.

76.title: Cathy
76.author: Cathy Guisewite.
76.series: Sept. 15, 1993) "Your Incessant Page Flipping has Cooled My Pasta"*
notes: Summary: Cathy's reading a dog care book about not confusing a dog's status, and Electra demands to have her food reheated.

77.title: Cathy
77.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
77.series: Dec. 21, 1993) "I'm Desperate and it has 'Golf' on it"*
notes: Summary: Cathy is in the golf gifts section, buying special golf balls and clothes, a book, a mug, a plaque, a waffle iron, etc.

78.title: Cathy
78.author: Guisewite.
78.series: Mar. 26, 1994) "Pardon Me, I Have to Go Shopping"*
notes: Summary: Cathy tells herself Alex will understand how a self-respecting woman doesn't need "kewpie doll dresses," but then he introduces her to Tom's mini-skirted girlfriend.

79.title: Cathy
79.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Irving has downsized Cathy out of a job, and now wants her to do a performance review of his hatchet skills.

80.title: Cathy
80.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Irving gives Cathy a list of business leads, confusing her disgust for him.
Key words: Cold calls, repulsion, spectra, endearment. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Leads"

81.title: Cathy
81.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Irving kisses Electra (the dog) goodbye, then says 'See you' to Cathy.
Key word: Men.

82.title: Cathy
82.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Irving was playing with Electra, and his after-shave is her, so Electra gets a bath.
Key words: Fumigation, noses, dogs. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Scents"

83.title: Cathy
83.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
83.series: July 31, 1997) "Don't You Love Working at Home"*
notes: Summary: Irving's visit postpones the start of Cathy's work day until 9:15 P.M.
Key words: Cleaning up, baths, home offices, messes, answering machines, messages. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Home Offices"

84.title: Cathy
84.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
84.series: Aug. 1, 1997) "Why Corporations don't Allow Shorts in the Office"*
notes: Key words: Ripples, fat, veins, wrinkles, knees, distractions. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Wrinkles"

85.title: Cathy
85.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Cathy does a follow-up call while Electra provides unwanted office noise.
Key words: Introductions, barking, growling, company heads, dogs. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Drooling"

86.title: Cathy
86.author: Cathy Guisewite.
86.series: June 13, 1998) "How Weird is That? He Brought His Dog on the Date"*
notes: Summary: Cathy has trouble leaving Electra to go on a date.

87.title: Cathy
87.author: Cathy Guisewite.
87.series: June 15, 1998) "The Dog : A Great Conversation-Starter, a Brilliant Conversation-Ender"*
notes: Summary: Electra won't stop barking at Danny and Franny.

88.title: Cathy
88.author: Cathy Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Electra barks at Cathy's date, and his dog Franny; he explains it by saying he smells like a dog from head to toe.

89.title: Cathy
89.author: Guisewite.
89.series: June 17, 1998) "Is There Anything So Pure as a Dog's Love?"*
notes: Summary: Electra is protecting Cathy from her date.

90.title: Cathy
90.author: Cathy Guisewite.
90.series: June 18, 1998) "Just Because We're the Same Species Doesn't Mean We Enjoy Each Other's Company!"*
notes: Summary: Electra doesn't want to play with Franny.

91.title: Cathy
91.author: Guisewite.
91.series: June 20, 1998) "Does She Snore? Does She Drool?"*
notes: Summary: Cathy and her date compare their dogs, Franny and Electra.

92.title: Cathy
92.author: Cathy Guisewite.
92.series: June 26, 1998) "My Mixed Breed : Part Dog, Part Blabbermouth"*
notes: Summary: Electra won't stop barking at Danny and Franny.

93.title: Cathy
93.author: Cathy Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Cathy greets Electra effusively, and Cathy's mom says, "ditto" to Cathy.

94.title: Cathy
94.author: Guisewite.
94.series: Aug. 21, 1999) "What Therapy Can't Solve, the Properly Timed Dog Biscuit Can"*
notes: Summary: Electra is acting cold and distant, but Cathy's mother knows how to proceed.

95.title: Cathy
95.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Irving has what everybody wants.

96.title: Cathy
96.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Irving's ready for the new century.

97.title: Cathy
97.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Cathy reacts to the ending of the Peanuts comic strip.

98.title: Cathy
98.author: Guisewite.
98.series: Oct. 9, 2000) "Maybe You Should Start with the Sweepstakes Entry Forms"*
notes: Summary: Cathy's going to reorganize the office.

99.title: Cathy
99.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Cathy has a lot of old phone messages that it's too late to answer, but she doesn't want to throw them away.

100.title: Cathy
100.author: Guisewite.
100.series: Nov. 10, 2000) "I Have a Picture of My New Dog, Vivian, in My Wallet"*
notes: Summary: Cathy is amazed at Irving's love for his dog.

101.title: Cathy
101.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
101.series: Dec. 6, 2000) "The Fine Male Art of Simultaneously Being Annoying and Endearing"*
notes: Summary: Irving treats his dog Vivian better than he's ever treated Cathy.

102.title: Cathy
102.author: Guisewite.
102.series: June 9, 2001) "Grandmas are all Wearing Tankinis This Year"*
notes: Summary: Cathy had hoped things would be more relaxed in the Grandma bathing suit section.

103.title: Cathy
103.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: Summary: The minister interprets the actions of the bride and groom as they climb a wall and rappel down, but Cathy sees a deeper meaning.

104.title: Cathy
104.author: Guisewite.
104.series: Oct. 9, 2001) "One Simple New Black Purse, Please!"*
notes: Summary: The first step in reorganizing a whole life.

105.title: Cathy
105.author: Guisewite.
105.series: Jan. 29, 2002) "Goodbye, Fashion Plate. Hello, Fashion Platter"*
notes: Summary: Notes the parallel upsizing of fast food portions and clothing styles.

106.heading: Cathy--Miscellanea.
106.title: "Cathy" p. 44-51 in Cartoonist Profiles, no. 101
106.author: [No author]
notes: Interview of Cathy Guisewite, by Tom Hatten. Includes photographs of Guisewite, and detailed example of creative process from idea to finished strip in 9 steps, plus other samples of the strip "Cathy."

107.heading: Cathy--Miscellanea.
107.title: Cathy : file of clippings and miscellany.
107.author: [No author]
notes: 1 portfolio : ill. ; 25 x 38 cm.
Includes material about comic strip creator Cathy Guisewite.
Collected at Michigan State University in the Russel B. Nye Popular Culture Collection's Popular Culture Vertical File (PCVF).

108.heading: Cathy--Miscellanea.
108.title: "Cathy Comic Strip Dropped for 'Political' Espousal" p. 26-27 in The Comics Journal, no. 126
108.author: [No author]
notes: About censorship.
Data from Pete Coogan.

109.heading: Cathy--Miscellanea.
109.title: 100 Years of American Newspaper Comics : an Illustrated Encyclopedia
109.author: edited by Maurice Horn.

112.heading: Cathy--Miscellanea.
112.title: Index entry to Cartoonist Profiles, no. 34
112.author: [No author]
notes: Data from R.C. Harvey.

113.heading: Cathy--Miscellanea.
113.title: Index entry to Cartoonist Profiles, no. 53
113.author: [No author]
notes: Data from R.C. Harvey.

115.heading: Cathy--Miscellanea.
115.title: Children of the Yellow Kid : the Evolution of the American Comic Strip
115.author: Robert C. Harvey

116.heading: Cathy--Miscellanea.
116.title: Comics, vom Massenblatt ins multimediale Abenteuer
116.author: Andreas C. Knigge

119.heading: Cathy--Miscellanea.
119.title: The Funnies, 100 Years of American Comic Strips
119.author: Ron Goulart

122.heading: Cathy--Miscellanea.
122.title: The Illustrated Encyclopedia of Cartoon Animals
122.author: Jeff Rovin

123.heading: Cathy--Miscellanea.
123.title: Women and the Comics
123.author: by Trina Robbins and Catherine Yronwode

124.heading: Cathy--Miscellanea.
124.title: "The Not-So Funnies"
124.author: by Ian Williams
124.appears_in: p. 15 in The Independent Weekly (Durham, N.C.), Aug. 9-15, 1995.
notes: The writer lists his least favorites: The Family Circus, Andy Capp, Snuffy Smith, The Soap Operas (meaning Rex Morgan M.D., Apartment 3-G, Mary Worth and Gil Thorp), Cathy.
Newspaper clipping.

125.heading: Cathy--Parodies, Imitations, Etc.
125.title: Foppé Johnson's 1993 Xmas Comix.
125.author: [No author]
notes: Takeoffs on The Far Side, Peanuts, The Katzenjammer Kids, Garfield, Blondie, Doonesbury, Cathy, and The Family Circus, used to make points about communication in management.

126.heading: A Cathy Calendar.
126.title: 1989, the Year of Commitment : a Cathy calendar
126.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: Reprints Sunday episodes of the comic strip Cathy. 1. Career girl comics. I. Guisewite, Cathy. II. The Year of Commitment. III. Cathy. Call no.: PN6728f.C37C3 1988

127.title: The Cathy Chronicles ; vol. 1 What's a Nice Single Girl Doing with a Double Bed?! : a Cathy book
127.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: (The Cathy Chronicles ; vol. 1) 1. Career girl comics. I. Guisewite, Cathy. II. Series. Call no.: PN6728.C37W47 1981

128.heading: A Cathy Collection.
128.title: Another Saturday Night of Wild and Reckless Abandon
128.author: by Cathy Guisewite ; with a foreword by Charles M
notes: (A Cathy Collection) 1. Career girl comics. I. Guisewite, Cathy. II. Schulz, Charles M. III. Series. Call no.: PN6728.C37G82 1982

129.heading: A Cathy Collection.
129.title: Between Love and Madness Lies the Shoe Department
129.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: ($14 in the Bank and a $200 Face in My Purse ; v. 2)
"1st Ballantine Books ed."
Cathy reprints.
Genre: Career girl.

131.heading: A Cathy Collection.
131.title: The Child Within has been Awakened, but the Old Lady on the Outside just Collapsed : a Cathy Collection
131.author: by Cathy Guisewite.

132.heading: A Cathy Collection.
132.title: The Collected Cathy : a 2-in-1 volume including : Another Saturday Night of Wild and Reckless Abandon and A Mouthful of Breath Mints and No One to Kiss
132.author: by Cathy Guisewite.

133.heading: A Cathy Collection.
133.title: Do We Validate for Aggravation?

168.title: Cathy
notes:
Newspaper comic strip about a career woman, by Cathy Guisewite. A chronological list of strip descriptions begins here. Please use these shortcuts to:
